newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai soybeans end mixed on uncertainties.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai soybeans end mixed on uncertainties.

text.p: Shanghai soybean futures ended mixed on Tuesday on uncertain short-term market trend with retail investors dominating Tuesday's market, traders said.
The most actively traded November 1997 contract ended at 3,291 yuan ($397) per tonne, losing seven yuan. It opened at an intraday high of 3,320 and hit a low of 3,290 yuan per tonne.
July fell 27 to 3,253, September three to 3,295, the January 1998 contract rose one yuan to 3,300 and March 90 to 3,300.
Combined volume rose to 19,800 tonnes from 19,100 tonnes.
Soybeans opened little changed from Monday's close and consolidated around opening levels for most of the session, traders said.
"Retail investors for quick profits dominated today's trading," one tader said. "But most institutional investors have little interest in trading because the market is so dull."
Traders said they expected soybeans to linger around current levels over the next few days.
